definition: calm/unruffled
surname Cong

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
surname Rong
to hold/to contain/to allow/to tolerate/appearance/look/countenance
(negative prefix)/not/no
variant of 迫[po4]/to persecute/to oppress/embarrassed
to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing

sentences.english: Who can show the country, take it leisurely and unoppressively?
sentences.chinese: 谁又能指点江山，从容不迫？

sentences.english: Therefore, he carefully studied unhurried manner until sufficient evidence is found.
sentences.chinese: 因此他从容不迫地仔细研究，直到发现足够证据。

sentences.english: Hindley descended more leisurely, sobered and abashed.
sentences.chinese: 辛德雷从容不迫地下来，酒醒了，也觉得羞愧了。
他保持着镇静并且从容不迫。

sentences.english: It is more convincing to behave calmly and unhurriedly than to air aggressively.
sentences.chinese: 从容不迫的举止比咄咄逼人的态度更能让人折服。

sentences.english: Now I can take my time visiting my relatives.
sentences.chinese: 现在我可以从容不迫地拜访我的亲戚。

definition: to go easy/unhurried/calm/Taiwan pr. [cong1 rong2]
cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
calm/composed/at ease
calm and composed (idiom)
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly
neither too fast nor too slow (idiom)
neither servile nor overbearing (idiom)/neither obsequious nor supercilious
to plan in advance (idiom)/a card up one's sleeve/forewarned is forearmed
calm and collected/unperturbed
neither haughty nor humble/neither overbearing nor servile/neither supercilious nor obsequious
to talk and laugh as though nothing had happened/to remain cheerful (despite a crisis)
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
steady/calm and collected/not nervous
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
tranquil and calm/indifferent
